intro: Limonium carolinianum var. nashii, commonly known as Carolina sea oats, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and small, blue to purple flower clusters. The plant typically grows in coastal dunes and sandy soils, adapting to salt spray and wind exposure. It produces seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its propagation along shorelines. Its botanical features make it an important component of coastal ecosystems.
